charoption.name: Alagondar Scion

prerequisite.note: If you don't meet this prerequisite, draw a different card.

entries: Jestem potomkiem linii krwi Alagondara i jedynym znanym spadkobiercą korony Neverwinter. Jeśli Dagult Neverember, władca-regent miasta, dowie się, że żyję, wyśle zabójców, aby mnie zabili.

charoption.name: Anvilwrought
entries: Zostałeś wykuty w ogniu kuźni Purphorosa. Twój wygląd ma metaliczny połysk i widoczne łączenia. W tabeli cech Anvilwrought znajdziesz szczegóły dotyczące twojego życia i pochodzenia. Dodatkowo zyskujesz następujące cechy.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: Zostałeś stworzony, aby mieć niezwykły hart ducha, reprezentowany przez następujące korzyści:

items: Masz przewagę w rzutach ratunkowych przeciwko byciu {@condition poisoned} i jesteś odporny na obrażenia od trucizny.
Nie musisz jeść, pić ani oddychać.
Nie musisz spać, a magia nie może cię uśpić.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: Kiedy robisz sobie długi odpoczynek, musisz spędzić co najmniej sześć godzin w stanie bezczynności, bez ruchu, a nie śpiąc. W tym stanie wydajesz się być bezwładny, ale to cię nie unieruchamia {@condition unconscious} i możesz normalnie widzieć i słyszeć.

entries.caption: Anvilwrought Characteristics
rows: Oread, który pracuje w kuźni Purphorosa, jest dla mnie najbliższym rodzicem.
Purphoros stworzył mnie, abym mu służył.
Zostałem stworzony kilkadziesiąt lat temu i w obawie, że staję się coraz bardziej przestarzały, niedawno uciekłem z góry Velus.
Purphoros żałuje, że zostałem stworzony i chce mnie przerobić na coś lepszego.
Purphoros chciał, abym kontynuował jego dzieło, tworząc jeszcze wspanialsze własne kreacje.
Ktoś w Mount Velus wszczepił we mnie straszliwą tajemnicę, aby przemycić ją w świat.

charoption.name: Cult of the Dragon Infiltrator
entries: Przeniknąłeś w szeregi Kultu Smoka. Szpiegując organizację od dłuższego czasu, dobrze znasz jej wewnętrzne funkcjonowanie i zwyczaje. Posiadasz drugą tożsamość jako inicjat kultu, wystarczającą do tego, by wtopić się w szeregi organizacji jako zwykły pracownik lub służący.

charoption.name: Deep Delver
entries: Masz talent do odnajdywania drogi w najgłębszych zakątkach świata. Potrafisz zapamiętać zakręty przejść i tuneli tak, że zawsze możesz odtworzyć swoje kroki pod ziemią. Dobrze znasz się też na zdobywaniu pożywienia i przetrwaniu w Podmroku i potrafisz określić, kiedy źródła pożywienia i wody są bezpieczne do spożycia. W Podmroku zawsze możesz znaleźć wystarczającą ilość jedzenia i wody dla siebie i maksymalnie pięciu innych osób, o ile w okolicy dostępne jest pożywienie.

charoption.name: Doppelganger
entries: Jestem zmiennokształtnym. Nie posiadam żadnych cech rasy, którą naśladuję, ale zachowuję swoje cechy klasowe, pochodzenie i wyrównanie. Mam {@sense darkvision} zasięgu do 60 stóp. Mogę użyć jednej z akcji, aby wykonać jedną z poniższych czynności:

Potrafię rzucać {@spell detect thoughts}, nie wymagając żadnych składników. Moją umiejętnością rzucania zaklęć jest Inteligencja. DC obrony przed Mądrością zaklęcia wynosi 8 + moja premia do biegłości + mój modyfikator Inteligencji. Potrafię polimorfować się w dowolnego humanoida, którego widziałem, lub powrócić do swojej prawdziwej postaci. Moje statystyki, poza rozmiarem, nie ulegają zmianie. Wyposażenie, które mam na sobie lub noszę, nie ulega przemianie. Po śmierci powracam do swojej prawdziwej postaci.

charoption.name: Dragon Scholar
entries: Przez wiele lat studiowałeś smoki i ich kulturę. Potrafisz automatycznie rozpoznawać miejsca zbudowane lub używane przez smoki i potrafisz rozpoznać smocze jaja i łuski na podstawie wzroku. Jeśli nie uda ci się wykonać testu na inteligencję, aby przypomnieć sobie wiedzę o smokach, znasz kogoś lub książkę, do której możesz zajrzeć, chyba że DM uzna, że wiedza ta jest nieznana.

charoption.name: Drizzt Fan
entries: Spotkałem kiedyś słynnego drowskiego strażnika Drizzta Do'Urdena! W rzeczywistości mam zniszczony kawałek jego słynnej zielonej peleryny i nigdy nie pomyślałbym, żeby się z nią rozstać.

charoption.name: Echoing Soul
entries: Twoja dusza nie jest twoją własną, a przynajmniej nie była nią zawsze. Niezależnie od tego, czy żyłeś w poprzednim życiu, czy Twoja dusza została zamieniona w inne ciało, czy też masz połączenie z inną istotą, doświadczasz echa z innego życia. Echa te dają Ci wiedzę, talenty, a nawet języki, które nie zawsze potrafisz wytłumaczyć, ale także nieoczekiwanie ingerują w Twoje postrzeganie i przekonania.
Rzuć na lub wybierz opcję z tabeli Echa Duszy, aby określić naturę tego Mrocznego Daru. Dodatkowo zyskujesz następujące cechy.

entries.caption: Soul Echoes
rows: Moja dusza jest połączona z duszą osoby z innego miejsca, być może z innej dziedziny, świata lub płaszczyzny.
Żyłem już wiele razy, a moja dusza za każdym razem, gdy umieram, raczej się reinkarnuje niż odchodzi.
Moja świadomość została usunięta z mojego pierwotnego ciała i wszczepiona do tego.
Byłam fizycznie i duchowo połączona z inną istotą.
Dzielę moje ciało z nieuchwytną siłą z innego świata.
Czas wokół mnie pęka, a ja czasami zderzam się z własną przeszłością lub przyszłością.

entries.name: Channeled Prowess
entries: Zdobywasz biegłość w dwóch dowolnie wybranych umiejętnościach.

entries.name: Inherent Tongue
entries: Można mówić, czytać i pisać w jednym wybranym języku dodatkowym.

entries.name: Intrusive Echoes
entries: Natychmiast po wykonaniu ataku, sprawdzeniu umiejętności lub rzutu ratunkowego i uzyskaniu wyniku 1 na {@dice d20}, wspomnienia twojej duszy pojawiają się i przejmują twoje postrzeganie i doświadczenia. Możesz widzieć ludzi wokół siebie jako kogoś innego, niż są, lub możesz być zdezorientowany przez podwójne doświadczenie otaczającego cię świata. Rzuć na tabelę Echa natrętne, aby określić efekt tych żywych wspomnień i wyobrażeń. Po wystąpieniu jednego z tych efektów, natrętne echa nie mogą pojawić się ponownie, dopóki nie zakończysz krótkiego lub długiego odpoczynku.

entries.caption: Intrusive Echoes
rows: Jesteś {@condition charmed} przez istotę, którą widzisz (wybraną przez DM) przez 1 minutę lub dopóki ta istota nie zada ci obrażeń.
Jesteś {@condition frightened} przez istotę, którą widzisz (wybraną przez DM) przez 1 minutę lub dopóki ta istota nie zada ci obrażeń.
Do końca swojej następnej tury postrzegasz inny czas lub miejsce wokół siebie. W tym czasie jesteś {@condition blinded} w stosunku do swojego rzeczywistego otoczenia.
Postrzegasz inny czas lub miejsce, które nakłada się na twoje otoczenie. Twoja prędkość jest zmniejszona o połowę do końca twojej następnej tury.
Wspomnienia i wrażenia przytłaczają cię. Do początku swojej następnej tury jesteś {@condition incapacitated}.
Twoja pamięć jest jednym z triumfów. Możesz powtórzyć test umiejętności, atak lub rzut ratunkowy, który właśnie wykonałeś. Musisz użyć nowego rzutu.

charoption.name: Elusive Paramour
entries: Bogaty pasza z Calimshan wyznaczył nagrodę za moją głowę za uwiedzenie jego ulubionej konkubiny. Łowcy nagród przeczesują Wybrzeże Mieczy w poszukiwaniu mnie, ale mam nadzieję, że nie wpadną na pomysł, by zajrzeć do Icewind Dale.

charoption.name: Escaped Prisoner
entries: Zostałem tu przywieziony z innego świata przez kosmicznych łowców umysłów. Statek, na którym byłem uwięziony, rozbił się w górach na południe od Ten-Towns. Po przeżyciu katastrofy omal nie zamarzłem na śmierć, przemierzając tundrę, aby dotrzeć do Ten-Towns. Gdyby nie znaleźli mnie przyjaźni traperzy, zginąłbym. Obawiam się, że niektórzy z moich porywaczy również przeżyli katastrofę i mogą mnie szukać.

charoption.name: Gathered Whispers
entries: Nawiedzają Cię istoty duchowe, czy to dusze zmarłych, czy też byty z innego planu. Ich głosy bez końca szepczą, kuszą i namawiają, czasem wznosząc nieziemskie wycie. Tylko ty możesz je dostrzec, chyba że pozwolisz im przemówić przez siebie. Duchy są niematerialne i niewidzialne; każdy, kto może widzieć {@condition invisible} stworzenia, widzi tylko przelotne przebłyski tych duchów, gdy cię nawiedzają.
Rzuć na lub wybierz opcję z tabeli Szepczących Duchów, aby określić, co cię nawiedza. Dodatkowo zyskujesz następujące cechy.

entries.caption: Whispering Spirits
rows: Czuwa nade mną rada moich zmarłych przodków.
Diabelskie istoty walczą o moją duszę.
Niespokojne dusze lgną do mnie i błagają o pokój.
Duchy tych, których zabiłem, krążą wokół mnie.
Do moich myśli wtargnęła obca inteligencja.
Rodzeństwo, którego nie mam, dzieli moje ciało.

entries.name: Spirit Whispers
entries: Uczysz się tego {@spell message} czaru, jeśli jeszcze go nie znasz, a do jego rzucenia nie potrzebujesz żadnych składników. Kiedy rzucasz zaklęcie, wiadomości są przekazywane przez jednego z twoich szepczących duchów, a nie przez ciebie lub głos celu. Twoją umiejętnością rzucania zaklęć jest Inteligencja, Mądrość lub Charyzma (wybór należy do ciebie, gdy otrzymujesz ten Mroczny Dar).

entries.name: Sudden Cacophony
entries: Kiedy zostaniesz trafiony atakiem, możesz wykorzystać swoją reakcję, aby przywołać swoje nawiedzające duchy i pozwolić, aby ich głosy wyły przez ciebie. Jeśli atakujący nie jest {@condition deafened}, dodaj swoją premię do biegłości do swojego AC przeciwko temu atakowi, potencjalnie powodując, że nie trafi. Jeśli raz ta cecha sprawi, że atak nie powiedzie się, nie możesz jej użyć ponownie, dopóki nie zakończysz długiego odpoczynku.

entries.name: Voices from Beyond
entries: Natychmiast po wykonaniu ataku, sprawdzeniu umiejętności lub rzutu ratunkowego i uzyskaniu wyniku 1 na {@dice d20}, nawiedzające głosy stają się zbyt głośne, by je zignorować. Rzuć na tabelę Głosy zza światów, aby określić efekt tych głosów. Po wystąpieniu jednego z tych efektów, żaden z tych nawiedzających głosów nie pojawia się ponownie, dopóki nie zakończysz krótkiego lub długiego odpoczynku.

entries.caption: Voices from Beyond
rows: Przy następnym ataku, sprawdzeniu umiejętności lub rzucie ratunkowym, który wykonujesz, masz minus.
Przez 1 minutę jesteś {@condition deafened} atakowany przez głosy.

Do końca swojej następnej tury jesteś {@condition frightened} najbliższym stworzeniem, innym niż ty sam. Jeśli kilka stworzeń jest najbliżej, DM wybiera, którego stworzenia jesteś {@condition frightened}.

W ciągu następnych 10 minut możesz zapytać swoje duchy o wyniki określonego działania, które zamierzasz podjąć w ciągu następnych 30 minut. Możesz otrzymać omen, tak jakbyś rzucił zaklęcie {@spell augury}. Wróżba objawia się jako szepty twoich duchów, które są słyszalne tylko dla ciebie.

charoption.name: Heroic Destiny
entries: W Twojej przyszłości czekają Cię wielkie czyny i trzeba będzie niezwykłego wysiłku, aby Cię zabić, zanim dokonasz tych czynów. Wybierz lub rzuć losowe przeznaczenie, korzystając z tabeli Heroicznego Przeznaczenia. Dodatkowo, zyskujesz następujące cechy.

entries.name: Defy Death
entries: Masz przewagę w rzutach ratujących przed śmiercią.

entries.name: Hard to Kill
entries: Jeśli zostaniesz zredukowany do 0 punktów życia, ale nie zostaniesz zabity, możesz zamiast tego spaść do 1 punktu życia. Jeśli raz użyjesz tej cechy, nie możesz jej użyć ponownie, dopóki nie zakończysz długiego odpoczynku.

entries.caption: Heroic Destiny
rows: Jestem skazany na bycie najbardziej uzdolnionym w jakiejś dziedzinie.
Moim przeznaczeniem jest zasłużyć na miejsce wśród gwiazd Nyx.
Jestem przeznaczony, by zostać bogiem.
Moim przeznaczeniem jest wyzwolić moją ukochaną ze szponów podziemnego świata.
Urodziłem się, gdy kraken pustoszył Meletis, i moim przeznaczeniem jest zniszczyć tego krakena.
Moim przeznaczeniem jest odkrycie tajemnicy mocy bogów.

charoption.name: Hollow One
entries: Jako Wydrążony, pustka po twojej duszy zostaje wypełniona dziwną magią Blightshore. Stanie się Pustym to nadprzyrodzony dar, który obdarza cię następującymi cechami.

entries.name: Ageless
entries: Nie starzejesz się, a efekty, które mogłyby spowodować starzenie się, nie działają na ciebie.

entries.name: Cling to Life
entries: Kiedy wykonasz rzut ratunkowy na śmierć i uzyskasz wynik 16 lub wyższy, odzyskujesz 1 punkt trafienia.

entries.name: Revenance
entries: Zachowujesz swój typ stworzenia, ale jesteś rozpoznawany jako nieumarły przez zaklęcia i inne efekty, które wykrywają obecność nieumarłego typu stworzenia.

entries.name: Unsettling Presence
entries: Jako akcję możesz wyprowadzić z równowagi istotę, którą widzisz w promieniu 15 stóp od siebie. Cel ma minus przy następnym rzucie ratunkowym, który wykona w ciągu następnej minuty. Konstrukty, nieumarli i stworzenia, które nie mogą być {@condition frightened} są odporne na tę cechę. Po użyciu tej cechy, nie możesz jej użyć ponownie, dopóki nie zakończysz długiego odpoczynku.

charoption.name: Iconoclast
entries: Nikt nie może zaprzeczyć istnieniu bogów Therosu, których obecność i czyny są widoczne na nocnym niebie, a czasem bezpośrednio w świecie śmiertelników. Jednak niektórzy ludzie odrzucają pogląd, że bogowie są godni czci. Tacy ikonoklaści są powszechni wśród leoninów, ale członkowie każdej kultury mogą przyjąć ten nadprzyrodzony dar. Tabela Charakterystyka Ikonoklastów zawiera sugestie dotyczące powodów, dla których stałeś się ikonoklastą.
Odrzucenie bogów daje ci nadprzyrodzoną siłę, dzięki której możesz przeciwstawić się ich wpływom na świat. Zyskujesz następujące cechy.

entries.name: Enlightened Protection
entries: Możesz rzucić {@spell protection from evil and good} z tą cechą, celując tylko w siebie i nie wymagając żadnych materialnych składników. Jeśli raz to zrobisz, nie możesz rzucać w ten sposób ponownie, dopóki nie zakończysz długiego odpoczynku. Mądrość jest twoją umiejętnością rzucania czarów dla tej cechy.

entries.name: Reject the Gods
entries: Nie możesz zyskać ani stracić pobożności do żadnego boga. Zamiast tego zyskujesz następujące cechy na poziomie postaci wymienionym przy każdej z nich. Mądrość jest twoją umiejętnością rzucania zaklęć dla każdego zaklęcia, które rzucasz dzięki tym cechom.

entries.name: Iconoclast Hero
entries: {@i 5th-level Iconoclast trait}
You can cast {@spell dispel magic} with this trait. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Iconoclast Paragon
entries: {@i 11th-level Iconoclast trait}
You can cast {@spell dispel evil and good} with this trait, requiring no material components. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.
In addition, when you cast {@spell dispel magic} using your Iconoclast Hero trait, you cast it as a 4th-level spell.

entries.name: Iconoclast Archetype
entries: {@i 17th-level Iconoclast trait}
You can cast {@spell antimagic field} with this trait, requiring no material components. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.
In addition, when you cast {@spell dispel magic} using your Iconoclast Hero trait, you cast it as a 5th-level spell.

entries.caption: Iconoclast Characteristics
rows: I blame the gods for the death of those I cared about.
Multiple gods seek to use me to their ends, so I try to avoid all divine entanglements.
It's obvious the gods are fickle and unworthy of worship.
I know the world's future lies with mortals, not gods.
I'm convinced the gods want me dead.
I refuse to be a pawn in divine schemes.

charoption.name: Inheritor
entries: An ancestor or mentor's deeds earned them a place in legend. Now it's your turn. You are the clear inheritor of a famed legacy. You've inherited a token from your predecessor, something that marks you as their inheritor, such as a signet ring, signature piece of clothing, or notable weapon.

Additionally, any time you reveal your legacy, you swiftly learn the local opinion of your predecessor. If locals have never heard of your predecessor, nothing changes. If they have, rumors of your connection spread swiftly, and many locals consider you either a hero or a threat. Heroes are welcomed and might easily gain an audience with local leaders. Threats are encouraged to leave before they invite danger.

charoption.name: Inscrutable
entries: Like a sphinx, you have a mind like a maze, impenetrable to mortal scrutiny. This might be a gift or training from an actual sphinx, the blessing (or curse) of a god, or an inexplicable talent. The Inscrutable Characteristics table suggests options for what makes you inscrutable. Additionally, you gain the following trait.

entries.name: Psychic Shield
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Sphinx's Shroud
entries: You are immune to any effect that allows other creatures to sense your emotions or read your thoughts. Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to ascertain your intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

entries.caption: Inscrutable Characteristics
rows: I was educated by a sphinx in the Dakra Isles.
I am a devout adherent to one of Meletis's schools of philosophy (detailed in {@book chapter 3|MOT|3|Meletis}).
I only speak in the past tense, as if all things I say have already transpired.
I have sworn a vow to allow no living person to see behind the mask that covers my face at all times.
Why wouldn't I phrase every statement as a question?
I was born a sphinx, but a god cursed me into humanoid form and saddled me with the limits of mortal knowledge. I won't rest until I break the curse.

charoption.name: Lifelong Companion
entries: Behind many heroes is another hero whose greatness comes from the support and love they offer. Haktos had his beloved Perynes, Renata was accompanied by her servant Karados, and Siona sailed with her devoted crew. Like these partners, you are great and make others great. Consider the Companion Relationships table when determining your legendary connection. Any relationship with another player's character requires that player's consent. Additionally, you gain the following traits.

entries.name: Boon Aura
entries: Your allies within 5 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}, provided you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Companion's Protection
entries: When a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to cause the attack to hit you instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.caption: Companion Relationships
rows: Another character is my lover or dearest friend.
Another character is my sibling.
Another character is my parent or child.
Another character is a champion of my god.
After admiring another character from afar, I've finally won a position by their side.
I want nothing more than for another character to recognize my devotion and love me in return.

charoption.name: Littlest Yeti
entries: I was raised by yeti. Although I relied on my ferocious guardians for food and warmth and never quite adapted to the cold, I speak Yeti and have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence yeti or improve their attitudes.

charoption.name: Living Shadow
entries: The shadow you cast is animate and ever-present, even when lighting conditions would otherwise prevent it. Your shadow occasionally moves out of sync with you. Sometimes it appears to be undertaking random but mundane tasks, while at other times it acts out your darker impulses, threatening or even attacking other shadows. With effort, you can bend this shadow puppetry to your will.
Roll on or choose an option from the Shadow Quirk table to determine how your living shadow behaves. Additionally, you gain the traits that follow.

entries.caption: Shadow Quirk
rows: My shadow often holds weapons or bears wounds that don't exist.
When I'm distracted, my shadow panics and tries to get other people's attention, as if it's desperate to escape me.
When it's not being watched, my shadow makes threatening gestures or creeps toward people.
My shadow's movements mirror mine incorrectly—when I raise my left hand, my shadow moves its right.
My shadow fiddles with or occasionally breaks Tiny, nonmagical objects.
There's a slight but noticeable delay between my movements and those of my shadow.

entries.name: Grasping Shadow
entries: You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip if you don't already know it, and require no components to cast it. The hand created by the spell is shadowy but is not bound to your actual shadow. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice when you gain this Dark Gift).

entries.name: Shadow Strike
entries: When you make a melee attack roll, you can increase your reach for that attack by 10 feet. Your shadow stretches and delivers the attack as if it were you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Ominous Will
entries: Immediately after you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw and roll a 1 on the {@dice d20}, your shadow exerts a will of its own and might assist or hinder you or those around you. The next time you or a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, roll a {@dice d4}. If the number is odd, reduce the total by the number rolled. If the number is even, increase the total by the number rolled. Once this effect occurs, it can't happen again until you finish a short or long rest.

charoption.name: Midwinter Child
entries: Auril the Frostmaiden has blessed me, for I was born on the Midwinter holiday. I have resistance to cold damage.

charoption.name: Mist Walker
entries: The Mists grip all who tread the Domains of Dread, but you know how to slip through their grasp. You can navigate the Mists successfully given enough time and a little luck, but this freedom comes with a price; if you remain in one area for too long, the Mists find you and drain your life force.
Roll on or choose an option from the Misty Travels table to determine how you developed this Dark Gift. Additionally, you gain the traits that follow.

entries.caption: Misty Travels
rows: You learned a secret about the nature of the Mists. Ever since, you can manipulate them, but the lands you walk have turned against you.
You fled into the Mists to escape someone or something that's hunting you. You can never rest for long, knowing you're still being pursued.
You're part of an organization, a family, or an itinerant community with experience traveling the Mists. They taught you how to do the same.
The Mists stole you from your home and fractured your memories of where you're from. You've been on a quest to find your way back ever since.

entries.name: Misty Step
entries: You can cast the {@spell misty step} spell, requiring no spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice when you gain this Dark Gift). If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

entries.name: Mist Traveler
entries: When you enter the Mists intent on reaching a specific domain, you are treated as if you possess a Mist talisman keyed to that domain. To use this trait, you must know the name of the domain you have chosen as your destination, but you don't need to have previously visited that land. This trait doesn't allow you to bypass domain borders closed by a Darklord's will.

entries.name: Poisoned Roots
entries: When you finish a long rest, the world around you in a 10-mile radius becomes a siphon that will eventually leech away your vitality. You can remain in the area safely for a number of weeks equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 week). Thereafter, each time you finish a long rest in the area, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} that can't be removed while you remain in the area.

charoption.name: Mist Wanderer
entries: The Mists whisper to you and guide you through their mysterious eddies. You immediately know if an object you're touching is a Mist talisman (detailed in {@book chapter 3|VRGR|3|Mist Talismans}). You recognize where the talisman originates from if you have been to its domain of origin.

charoption.name: Nyxborn
entries: Born from the minds of the gods, the creatures that populate the gods' realm are called Nyxborn. Nyxborn creatures resemble mortal beings, but philosophers debate their true character. Are they idealized forms of mortal beings, free from the imperfections and transience that causes mortals to suffer and die? Or are they hollow and soulless shades, lacking the authenticity and pathos that make mortal existence worthwhile?

A Nyxborn is like a fragment of divinity, an idea or a dream that is incarnate. You embody an idea—like the way leaves turn toward the sun or the feeling of ocean sand between the toes, the way the heart stirs when the tide of battle changes or the sadness that lingers when remembering a happy moment of childhood.

These ideas, dreams, memories, and feelings are the stuff Nyx is made of, and a Nyxborn is shaped from that raw material. You might have been specifically crafted by one of the gods to serve a certain purpose. Or your existence could be an accident caused by a confluence of supernatural forces. The Nyxborn Origin table offers a handful of suggestions that might explain how you came to be, and the Nyxborn Quirks table describes some special effects that might linger around your person.
Additionally, you gain the following traits.

entries.name: Cloak of Stars
entries: As an action, you wrap yourself in a starry cloak, appearing like a silhouette formed of the night sky. When you do, attack rolls have disadvantage against you. This cloak lasts for 1 minute, until you doff it (no action required), or until you die. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Nyxborn Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage.

entries.caption: Nyxborn Origin
rows: One of my parents is a nyxborn, a nymph, or some other supernatural creature.
I was formed from Nyx by one of the gods to serve as a divine emissary.
I'm a side effect of some other divine action.
A god witnessed my birth, making me what I am.
I was rescued from the Underworld and took on supernatural characteristics when I returned to life.
I'm a song or other work of art brought to life.

entries.caption: Nyxborn Quirks
rows: Whenever my weapon strikes something, the weapon gives off a shower of starry sparks.
My hair moves as if in a perpetual breeze.
My anger smells like burning autumn leaves.
When the sun shines on me just so, I glimmer with many colors.
My laughter causes nearby birds to erupt in song.
People who sleep near me always dream of the sea.

charoption.name: Old Flame
entries: I have a lover in Ten-Towns whom I haven't seen in years. At any time outside of combat, I can decide who the lover is by choosing an NPC in Ten-Towns that I can see. Once I make this choice, I can't change it. This old flame is friendly and helpful toward me, even if our past is checkered.

charoption.name: Oracle
entries: You possess a precious gift coveted not just by mortals but by the gods themselves: the gift of clear communication between the mortal and divine realms. As an oracle, you can perceive the whims of the gods and petition them for glimpses of their vast insight. This gift also comes with a curse, though, which typically takes the form of dire insights. Consult the Oracle Curse table to determine what unwanted revelations you receive.

The gods seek mortal oracles to act as their agents. As a result, most oracles devote themselves to the service of a single god and learn to ignore the voices of all others. Occasionally, two gods agree to share the services of an oracle. Oracles who try to remain independent often find themselves pursued by the agents of evil gods who would bind them to the god's service, if necessary.
You gain the following traits.

entries.name: Ears of the Oracle
entries: You can speak, read, and write Celestial, the language of the gods. In addition, a god might deliver a message through you, and you can decide whether to use your own voice or to allow the god's voice to come through your mouth to deliver the message, translated into any language you speak.

entries.name: Oracle's Insight
entries: The gods give you flashes of insight that help you bring your efforts to fruition. When you make an ability check, you can roll a {@dice d10} and add the number rolled to the check. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to add the {@dice d10}, but you must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Oracle's Piety
entries: Your oracular abilities improve as your piety score increases. Instead of gaining the piety benefits associated with any god (as described in {@book chapter 2|MOT|2|Piety}), you gain the following traits when you reach the specified piety score.
Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for any spell that you cast through these traits.

entries.name: Augur
entries: {@i Piety 3+ Oracle trait}
You can cast {@spell augury} as a ritual with this trait. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Seer
entries: {@i Piety 10+ Oracle trait}
You can cast {@spell divination} as a ritual with this trait. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Sibyl
entries: {@i Piety 25+ Oracle trait}
You can cast {@spell commune} as a ritual with this trait. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.
You also can't be surprised, provided you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Divine Oracle
entries: {@i Piety 50+ Oracle trait}
You can increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 2, as well as increasing your maximum for the chosen score by 2.

entries.caption: Oracle Curse
rows: I know exactly how I'm going to die, and I can't do or say anything to prevent it.
People who consult me for information rarely believe the answers I give them.
I'm haunted by nightmares foretelling the deaths of people I've never met.
I'm often distracted by the sights and sounds of things that other people can't perceive.
A horrible monster in Nyx watches me constantly, and I see it every time I venture outdoors.
Any time I grow close to someone, I see them aged, dying, or dead.
Whenever I receive a divine vision, I get an intense pain in my head or chest.
One of the gods intends to use me as an oracle whether I want to listen or not.

charoption.name: Orc Stone
entries: I saved the life of an orc, who gave me a stone with the symbol of the Many-Arrows tribe (a humanoid skull pierced by three arrows) carved into it. The stone is an uncommon magic item that requires attunement, and only I can attune to it.

As an action, I can use the stone to summon the spirit of an orc warrior, which appears within 30 feet of me. The spirit uses the orc war chief stat block in the Monster Manual and disappears after 10 minutes or when reduced to 0 hit points. The spirit understands any language I speak and obeys my commands.
After the stone is used three times, it turns to dust.

charoption.name: Owlbear Whisperer
entries: Owlbears are predisposed to like me.

If I am within 10 feet of an owlbear, I can use an action to make a {@dc 10} Charisma ({@skill Animal Handling}) check. On a success, I change the owlbear's attitude toward me from hostile to indifferent or from indifferent to friendly.

charoption.name: Pious
entries: Born with a particular connection to a deity, you have been winning favor with your god since birth. Consult the Pious Quirks table to determine how your faith might influence your personality. Additionally, you gain the following traits.

entries.name: Pious Protection
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it, and you must use the new roll. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Religious Study
entries: You have advantage on any Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) check pertaining to your chosen god.

entries.name: Starting Piety
entries: You begin with a piety score of 3 with your chosen god.

entries.caption: Pious Quirks
rows: I often call people by the name of my god (or another god) by accident.
I stay up late at night watching the stars in hopes that my god will share a message with me.
I'm deeply jealous of my god's oracles, who seem to have a more intimate relationship with my god than I can ever hope to attain.
I dream of one day entering Nyx and being granted a permanent place at my god's side.
I have no home besides the temples of my god.
I can't prove it, but I suspect that my god might actually be my parent.

charoption.name: Pirate Cannibal
entries: I served aboard Dark Duchess, a pirate ship from the city of Luskan. After the vessel got stuck in the ice, everyone but the captain abandoned the vessel and fled to Ten-Towns. We got lost in a blizzard along the way. I was the only one who made it, and only by eating my mates. The ship and its treasure are still out there.

charoption.name: Reghed Heir

prerequisite.note: If you don't meet this prerequisite, draw a different card.

entries: I am the offspring of Queen Bjornhild Solvigsdottir, leader of the Tiger Tribe. My mother cast me into the Sea of Moving Ice when I was a young child as a sacrifice to Auril the Frostmaiden. A polar bear pulled me from the water and spared me a freezing death. This bear then transformed into a goliath who bore me safely to Ten-Towns. I remember the goliath's name—Oyaminartok—but haven't seen her since. I owe her my life, just as I owe my mother a merciless death.

charoption.name: Reincarnation
entries: I died and was brought back to life by a friendly human druid using the {@spell reincarnate} spell. I have no idea what became of the druid, whose name I don't know. I retain the memories of my previous life, some or all of which was spent in Icewind Dale. (Roll on the table in the spell's description to determine your character's previous race, or choose a race from the table that you like, then flesh out the story of your previous life.)

charoption.name: Ring Hunter
entries: I am looking for the knucklehead trout that bit off my father's finger, which had a signet ring on it. To preserve my inheritance, I must retrieve the lost ring.

charoption.name: Runaway Author
entries: I penned a notorious exposé called "The Hellbent Highborn," which accused several prominent patriars in Baldur's Gate and nobles in Waterdeep of being devil worshipers. Although my accusations were well founded, I made a lot of enemies and was forced to seek refuge in Icewind Dale.

charoption.name: Second Skin
entries: There is another side of you that most people never see. When you show this side of yourself, you might become another person entirely, a celestial-like avenger, or a walking nightmare. Whatever the specifics of this form, it exaggerates some drive or hidden nature within you.
Roll on or choose an option from the Second Form table to determine this other side of yourself. Additionally, you gain the traits that follow.

entries.caption: Second Form
rows: An exaggerated version of your own form
Hybrid form of humanoid and beast
An angelic, a demonic, or an aberrant form
A vaguely human-shaped creature made of slime
A fey-like shape, either brooding or passionate
A body constructed of metal, stone, or machinery

entries.name: Transformation
entries: You can cast the {@spell alter self} spell to appear in your second form. When you do so, you gain the effects of that spell's Change Appearance option and cannot end it to gain the benefits of a different option. Casting {@spell alter self} in this way requires no spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice when you gain this Dark Gift). If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

When you cast {@spell alter self} using this feature, some cosmetic aspect of your second form remains after the spell ends. This visibly marks you unless you actively hide or disguise it. The mark is a perceptible change such as scaly skin, stunted wings, eyes without pupils, or horns. The mark fades after you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Involuntary Change
entries: Certain circumstances can activate your Dark Gift. After you experience this catalyst, at the start of your next turn you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or use your action to cast {@spell alter self} as described in the Transformation trait, even if you have already used it.
Roll on or choose an option from the Change Catalyst table to determine what triggers your involuntary change.

entries.caption: Change Catalyst
rows: Seeing a particular phase of the moon
The smell of a certain type of flower
The sound of ringing temple bells
Hearing a particular melody
Touching pure silver with your bare skin
Seeing someone resembling a specific individual

charoption.name: Slaad Host
entries: A red slaad implanted a pellet-sized egg in me shortly before I started my adventuring career. If I can't get rid of it in the next two months, the egg will gestate inside me, and a slaad tadpole will burst from my chest, killing me. It will then quickly grow into an adult slaad and kill even more people.

charoption.name: Spirit Medium
entries: After a fateful experience, you believe you're aligned with spirits and can serve as a conduit for their insights and goals. You have advantage on any {@skill Arcana} or {@skill Religion} check you make to remember or research information about spirits and the afterlife. Additionally, you begin your adventuring career with a custom-made device for communing with otherworldly forces, perhaps a spirit board, a tarokka deck, an automatic writing planchette, dowsing rods, a cup for tea leaves, or a device of your own design. Add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make using this type of divining tool.

charoption.name: Spy
entries: I'm a spy for the Harpers, a secretive organization that works behind the scenes to thwart tyrants and other evildoers. My mission in Icewind Dale is to safeguard the settlements of Ten-Towns while concealing my Harper affiliation. Credible threats to Ten-Towns include the Arcane Brotherhood, an organization of wizards based in Luskan, and the Zhentarim, an expansive shadow network that wants to control trade throughout the North. Both have threatened Ten-Towns in the past.
My only Harper contact in Ten-Towns is a human named Beldora, who poses as a homeless woman and spends her days gathering information in Bryn Shander.

charoption.name: Symbiotic Being
entries: A second being resides within your body along with you. It manifests physically somewhere on you and relies on you for its survival. At the same time, it offers you knowledge and other assistance, either of its own volition or because of your intertwined nature. The symbiote has its own personality and agenda, which might be at odds with yours. If you ignore the symbiote's desires, it might strive to interfere with you. There is no way to be rid of the symbiote while you have this Dark Gift. Even if you go to drastic lengths, such as severing the part of your body where the symbiote resides, it reappears on your body in another location at the next midnight.
Roll on or choose an option from the Symbiotic Nature table to determine what sort of symbiotic being shares your body. Additionally, you gain the traits that follow.

entries.caption: Symbiotic Nature
rows: Tiny humanoid facial features protruding from your torso, palm, or the back of your head
An alien appendage inside an unhealing wound
A burrowing, worm-like being
An intrusive thought that inhabits your mind
A living tattoo
Crystal growths that replace a portion of your body

entries.name: Entwined Existence
entries: Your symbiote is a separate entity with its own physical form bound to yours. It isn't a separate creature and relies on you to survive. It has Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. The DM sets the symbiote's abilities or determines them randomly (roll {@dice 4d6} for each score, ignoring the lowest roll and totaling the rest). The symbiote can see and hear using your senses.

The symbiote speaks, reads, and understands two languages; one that you speak, as well as one appropriate to its nature. Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Deception}, {@skill History}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Religion}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Persuasion}. You gain proficiency in that skill if you don't already have it, representing the symbiote's counsel and guidance.
If you die, so does your symbiote. If you are subsequently returned to life, your symbiote revives as well.

entries.name: Sustained Symbiosis
entries: Your symbiote has a vested interest in your survival and takes steps to ensure it. When you fail a saving throw, you can choose to have your symbiote expend one of your Hit Dice to roll it and add the number rolled to the saving throw, potentially turning the failure into a success. If it uses this feature on a death saving throw, you succeed on the save and regain 1 hit point regardless of the number rolled on the {@dice d20}.
Once you succeed on a saving throw due to this trait, the symbiote can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Symbiotic Agenda
entries: Your symbiote has an agenda that drives it, and it expects you to assist it in achieving those goals. How permissive or patient it is in resolving its agenda depends on its personality (work with your DM to determine these details). If you have an opportunity to advance its agenda and don't act on it, the symbiote can try to force your hand. You must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 12 + the symbiote's Charisma modifier) or be {@condition charmed} by the symbiote for {@dice 1d12} hours. While {@condition charmed}, you must try to follow the symbiote's commands. If you take damage that is not self-inflicted, you can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
Roll or choose from the Symbiotic Agenda table to determine the symbiote's goal, working with your DM to detail the specifics or create another agenda.

entries.caption: Symbiotic Agenda
rows: The symbiote seeks to destroy a specific type of being, such as fiends, trolls, or paladins.
The symbiote craves knowledge and is determined to solve a mystery or learn a secret.
The symbiote wants to bring a prophecy to fruition or to thwart one.
The symbiote seeks to defend the servants and interests of a powerful being or organization.
The symbiote wants to keep you from harm at all costs and believes it knows what's best for you.
The symbiote seeks to experience new sensations, the more bizarre the better.

charoption.name: Touch of Death
entries: Your touch is pain, harming whoever you come in contact with. The deathly power within you is beyond your control, afflicting any who touch your bare skin. By the same token, you can deliver death to your enemies with your touch.
Roll on or choose an option from the Deadly Touch table to determine how this Dark Gift presents itself. Additionally, you gain the traits that follow.

entries.caption: Deadly Touch
rows: Your body is alchemically or biologically altered, infusing you with deadly chemicals.
The magic of a slighted druid or fey makes small plants wither and insects die in your presence.
You're the harbinger of a grim prophecy. Any creature your touch damages is marked with a temporary scar of a group, fiend, deity, or other force that takes an interest in you.
You survived a near-death experience—but shouldn't have. Ever since, death and ill omens follow you.
You are out of sync with time or reality. Anything you touch is warped by the distortion.
Every time you touch a creature, you hear the laughter of someone you once harmed.

entries.name: Death Touch
entries: You can focus your deadly touch against your foes. As an action, make one unarmed strike. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage. This damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

entries.name: Inescapable Death
entries: When you hit a target with an attack roll and deal necrotic damage, you ignore the target's resistance to that damage.

entries.name: Withering Contact
entries: When you start your turn grappling a creature or {@condition grappled} by it, the creature takes {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage.

charoption.name: Trauma Survivor
entries: You survived. Whatever it was, you made it through, and you can help others do the same. People view you as an expert on the traumatic situation you faced—be it a specific sort of violence, illness, or otherwise. You are aware of nonmagical recovery techniques, common resources, and misinformation. You know how to speak to sympathetic doctors, clergy, and local leaders and can convince them to shelter one person (other than yourself) at a modest lifestyle for up to one month.

charoption.name: Traveler
entries: You come from somewhere else, a place others couldn't begin to understand. Perhaps your home is a unique corner of the Land of the Mists or another world entirely. In any case, you and other travelers have shared experiences. You can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate among sympathetic trading caravans, itinerant families, or displaced groups, so long as you don't present yourself as a danger. Such groups will hide you from the law or anyone searching for you, though they won't risk their lives for you. Additionally, you can tell whether an object you can see and touch is from your homeland with near perfect accuracy.

charoption.name: Underdark Experience
entries: You are no casual visitor to the Underdark, but instead have spent considerable time there learning its ways. You are familiar with the various races, civilizations, and settlements of the Underdark, as well as its major routes for travel. If you fail an Intelligence check to recall some piece of Underdark lore, you know a source you can consult for the answer unless the DM rules that the lore is unknown.

charoption.name: Unscarred
entries: Like the great hero Haktos, you are resistant to physical harm. Use the Unscarred Origin table to determine how you gained your legendary invulnerability. Additionally, you gain the following trait.

entries.name: Unscarred Resilience
entries: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.caption: Unscarred Origin
rows: I was bathed in hydra's blood as an infant, and my wounds close too quickly to become mortal injuries.
I swallowed a magic stone that fell from Nyx, which made my skin hard as rock.
When I was wounded as a child, a god healed me. Now wounds are reluctant to undo the god's work.
I was rescued from the Underworld, and I'm not sure I fully returned to life—it's always so cold.
I was born on one of the Dakra Isles. All my people are naturally resilient, a fact I didn't realize until I lost my home and ventured into the world.
I don't know who one or more of my parents is, but my resilience (and other hints) provide clues to their immortal identity.

charoption.name: Watchers
entries: Something is always watching you and draws ethereal spirits that take the form of creatures made of shadowstuff, usually in the shape of Tiny beasts, that follow you and gather in your general vicinity. These creatures act like normal examples of their kind, but their behavior suggests a hint of malice. No matter what precautions you take, you can't permanently drive these spirits away. They always return, wait just beyond the reach of deterrents, or later crawl out of your clothes and equipment.
Roll on or choose an option from the Watchers table to determine what sorts of forms the spirits typically take when they follow you.

entries.caption: Watchers
rows: Carrion Eaters. Jackals, ravens, vultures
Inescapable Judgments. Animate tools of punishment, drifting eyeballs, religious iconography
Night Wings. Bats, moths, owls
Plague Carriers. Fleas, rats, squirrels
Unnatural Observers. Animate objects, clockwork devices, otherworldly voyeurs
Sea Skulkers. Crabs, eels, jellyfish
Stray Souls. Ghost orbs, shadows, ectoplasmic wisps
Venomous Vermin. Scorpions, serpents, spiders

entries.name: Borrowed Eyes
entries: As an action, you can influence the presence guiding the watchers for 1 hour. For the duration, you gain advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, and you can't be {@condition blinded}. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Dread Presence
entries: You have disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}), Charisma ({@skill Performance}), and Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks made against creatures that can see the watchers, and you have disadvantage on saving throws made against the {@spell scrying} spell.

You can temporarily disperse or hide the watchers with some effort. With 1 minute of work and a successful DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Animal Handling}) check, you can suppress your Borrowed Eyes and Dread Presence for 1 hour. Once you successfully suppress these features, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
